data.title: What Happened in November 1991
data.meta_description: What happened in November 1991. Browse historical events, famous birthdays and notable deaths from Nov 1991 or search by date, day or keyword.
data.text:
Historical Events

Last of Kuwait oil well fires extinguished by Canadian well control team "SafetyBOSS"

Nov 1 New Dutch Regulations Traffic rules & Traffic signs enforced

Nov 1 Three faculty, and one staff member of the department of physics and astronomy, were killed, along with one administrator, when physics graduate student Gang Lu went on a shooting rampage at the University of Iowa.

Rugby World Cup

2nd Rugby World Cup Final, Twickenham: Australia beats England, 12-6 with Wallabies fly-half Michael Lynagh landing 2 penalties and a conversion

Nov 2 Bartholomew I becomes the Patriarch of Constantinople, head of 300 million followers of the Eastern Orthodox Church

Nov 2 Breeders' Cup Horse Racing, Churchill Downs; winners: Arazi, Black Tie Affair, Dance Smartly (leading female thoroughbred money-earner, with $3,083,456), Miss Alleged, Opening Verse, Pleasant Stage, Sheikh Albadou

Nov 2 Jermaine Jackson releases "Word to the Badd!!" anti Michael song

Nov 2 Nevada makes biggest comeback in NCAA football history, overcoming a 35 point 3rd quarter deficit to rally and beat Weber State, 55-49

F1 World Champion

Ayrton Senna wins Australian Grand Prix in Adelaide; shortest F1 race ever run (14 laps) because of wet conditions; Senna retains his 3rd World Drivers Championship by 24 points from Nigel Mansell

Nov 3 New York City Marathon: Salvador Garcia of Mexico men's champion in 2:09:28; Liz McColgan of Scotland wins women's title, 2:27.0

Event of Interest

Imelda Marcos returns from exile to the Philippines and was arrested the next day for tax fraud and corruption and soon released on $6,400 bail

Nov 4 Mid East peace conference ends in Madrid Spain

Kiichi Miyazawa elected premier of Japan

Nov 5 Richard J Kerr ends term as acting director of CIA

"Moscow Circus Cirk Valentin" opens at Gershwin NYC for 32 performances

Nov 6 Grand Duke Vladimir Kirillovitsj returns to St Petersburg

Nov 6 Keck II, biggest telescope in use at Mauna Kea Hawaii

Nov 6 Maximus 2.0 BBS released

Nov 6 Robert M Gates, becomes 15th director of CIA

Communist Party Outlawed

Russian President Boris Yeltsin outlaws the Communist Party

Kuwaiti Oil Fires

The last oil fire in Kuwait set by retreating Iraqi troops is extinguished

"Park Your Car in Harvard Yard" opens at Music Box NYC

Nov 7 1st NBA game in Delta City, Utah Jazz beats Seattle 103-95

Magic Johnson

Magic Johnson announces he has HIV virus & retires from LA Lakers

Revival of Alan Jay Lerner and Frederick Loewe's musical "Brigadoon" opens at New York State Theater, NYC; runs for 12 performances

Paul Coffey

Paul Coffey sets NHL defenseman scoring mark with 311th goal

Houston's Roman Anderson is 1st NCAA to kick 400 pts

Nov 9 Joint European Torus (JET) scientists in Culham England successfully harness nuclear fusion to produce the first large amount of controlled fusion power

Bernie Kosar ends NFL record of 308 passes without an interception

Nov 10 Browns set club record for largest lead blown (led 23-0), Philadelphia 32-30

Navratilova Equals Evert's Record

Martina Navratilova ties Chris Evert with 157 pro tennis tournament wins

Nov 10 Marty Glickman broadcasts his 1,000th football game

Nov 10 South Africa's 1st cricket international since 1970 - one-day v India

Tom Glavine

Atlanta Brave Tom Glavine wins NL Cy Young Award

Nov 12 Dili Massacre, Indonesian forces open fire on a crowd of protesters in Dili, East Timor, killing at least 250

Full House

US TV series "Full House" 100th episode, the twins are born

Bomb destroys Dutch Labour party politician Aad Kosto's house in a failed assassination attempt, he survives and in a famous image finds and cuddles his cat

Clemens AL Cy Young

Boston Red Sox Roger Clemens wins AL Cy Young Award

Lockerbie Bombing of Pan Am Flight 103

American and British authorities announce indictments against two Libyan intelligence officials for the downing of Pan Am Flight 103

Prince Norodom Sihanouk

Cambodian Prince Norodom Sihanouk returns to Phnom Penh after thirteen years of exile

Black or White

Michael Jackson's "Black or White" music video with groundbreaking morphing effects premieres simultaneously in 27 countries on MTV, Fox TV and BBC's Top of the Pops

Nov 14 Pittsburgh Steelers guard Terry Long loses his steroids appeal and is suspended without pay by NFL for 4 weeks

Dow Jones avg drops 120.31 points (5th largest dive)

Nov 15 Ricky Pierce (Seattle) begins NBA free throw streak of 75 game

1st TV condom ad aired (FOX- TV)

Earnhardt Wins NASCAR

41st NASCAR Sprint Cup: Dale Earnhardt wins

Nov 17 Detroit Lion Mike Utley is paralized in a game vs LA Rams

Sampras' First ATP

In an all-American final Pete Sampras wins his first of 5 ATP Tour World Championship tennis titles with a 3–6, 7–6, 6–3, 6–4 victory over Jim Courier in Frankfurt, Germany

Nov 17 Revival of Alan Jay Lerner and Frederick Loewe's musical "Brigadoon" closes at New York State Theater, NYC, after 12 performances

Auburn men's basketball team placed on 2 yr probation for recruiting violations and not eligible for post-season play 1991-92

Nov 18 France deports Marlon's daughter Cheyenne Brando to Tahiti

Nov 18 Muslim Shi'ites release hostages Terry Waite & Thomas Sutherland

Siege of Vukovar Ends

The Croatian city of Vukovar surrenders to Yugoslav People's Army and allied Serb paramilitary forces after an 87-day siege

Ripken 2nd MVP

Baltimore Orioles shortstop Cal Ripken wins his 2nd AL MVP

Atlanta Braves Terry Pendleton wins NL MVP

Poetess Maria Elene Cruz Varela arrested in Cuba

Phool Aur Kaante

"Phool Aur Kaante", the film debut of famous Indian actor Ajay Devgan, is released

The Addams Family

Film "The Addams Family" starring Raul Julia, Anjelica Huston and Christina Ricci is released

Ewing's $18.8 Million

NY Knicks pay Patrick Ewing a record $18.8 million for 2 yr extension

Brigham Young University quarterback Ty Detmer finishes NCAA career with record 4,031 yards passed in a season, and 15,031 yards for career

Holyfield vs. Cooper

Evander Holyfield TKOs Bert Cooper in 7 for heavyweight boxing title

Mercury Confirms AIDs

Freddie Mercury, 45, confirms he has AIDS the day before he dies

Nov 23 Martín López-Zubero swims world record 200m backstroke (1:56.57)

Nov 23 Sacramento Kings ends NBA's longest road losing streak at 43 games

1st international flight from Long Island's MacArthur Airport (to Mexico)

Nov 24 After going 12-0, Washington Redskins lose to Dallas 24-21

Toronto Argonauts Win

CFL Grey Cup, Winnipeg Stadium: Toronto Argonauts defeat Calgary Stampeders, 36-21; Argos under new ownership of LA Kings owner Bruce McNall, hockey player Wayne Gretzky and actor John Candy

Seles' Prize Money Record

Monica Seles sets female tennis record, winning prize money of $2,457,758 in a year

Nov 24 Rachmon Nabijev elected president of Tajikistan

Nov 24 US 75th manned space mission "STS 44" Atlantis 10 launched

Nov 24 Yugoslavian tennis star Monica Seles beats Martina Navratilova 6–4, 3–6, 7–5, 6–0 to win her 2nd straight WTA Tour Championship at Madison Square Garden, NYC

Condoms are handed out to thousands of NY High School students

Poetess Maria Elene Cruz Varela sentenced to 2 years (Cuba)

Nov 27 Revival of Leigh, Charlap, Styne, Comden and Green's musical "Peter Pan", starring Cathy Rigby, opens at Minskoff Theater, NYC; runs for 48 performances

Undertaker vs. Hulk Hogan

Undertaker beats Hulk Hogan to become new WWF champ

Dust storm in California's San Joaquin Valley, results in massive vehicle accident on Interstate I-5 involving 93 cars and 11 truck. near Coalinga; 17 die and 150 injured

Nov 29 Test Cricket debut of Javagal Srinath, v Australia at the Gabba

Nov 29 TV show "Roc" has a gay wedding episode - Can't Help Loving that Man

56th Iron Bowl: Alabama beats Auburn 13-6 in Birmingham, Alabama

Nov 30 FIFA Women's World Cup Final, Tianhe Stadium, Guangzhou, China: Michelle Akers scores twice as US beats Norway, 2-1

Nov 30 Rob Pilatus, 27, of disgraced pop duo Milli Vanilli attempts suicide

Nov 30 San Diego State's Marshall Faulk is 1st freshman to capture national rushing and scoring titles

Famous Birthdays

Anthony Ramos

American actor and singer-songwriter (Hamilton), born in New York City

Nov 1 Jiang Yuyuan, Chinese gymnast (Olympic teams gold 2008), born in Liuzhou, Guangxi

Jimmy Garoppolo, American NFL player (San Francisco 49ers), born in Arlington Heights, Illinois

DanTDM [Daniel Middleton], British professional gamer and YouTube personality (The Diamond Minecraft), born in Aldershot, England

Zo In-sung, South Korean actor (Something Happened in Bali; That Winter, the Wind Blows), born in Seoul, South Korea

Christa B. Allen, American actress (Revenge), born in Wildomar, California

Kathleen Herles, American child voice actress (Dora the Explorer, and Go, Diego, Go! - "Dora"), born in Queens, New York

Matt Bennett, American actor (Victorious), born in Massapequa Park, New York

Shailene Woodley

American actress (The Fault in Our Stars), born in San Bernardino County, California

Anurag Kashyap, 2005 Scripps National Spelling Bee champion, born in Muzaffarpur, India

Nur Atikah Nabilah, Singaporean gymnast, born in Singapore

Famous Weddings

Douglas Adams

Author Douglas Adams (39) weds Jane Belson

Famous Deaths

Fran Stevens, singer, dies of cancer in Bronx NY at 72

Nov 2 Irwin Allen, American film and television producer (Land of the Giants; The Poseidon Adventure), dies at 75

Nov 2 Mort Shuman, American singer, and songwriter, with Doc Pomus ("Viva Las Vegas"; "Save The Last Dance For Me"), dies of cancer at 54

Fred MacMurray, American actor (Double Indemnity, The Apartment, My Three Sons), dies of pneumonia at 83

Nov 5 Robert Maxwell, Czech-British billionaire publisher, politician and fraudster (Mirror Group, NY Daily News), drowns at sea at 68

André Vandernoot, Flemish flautist and conductor (Royal Flemish Opera, 1959-73), dies at 64

Tom of Finland [Touko Laaksonen], Finnish fetish artist, dies at 71

Frances Faye, American cabernet singer and actress (Pretty Baby), dies after a stroke ay 79

Nov 8 John Kirkpatrick, American pianist (Concord Sonata) and musicologist (Charles Ives Archives), dies at 86

Guido Claus, Belgian actor (Sacrament), dies

Nov 9 Yves Montand [Ivo Livi], Italian-French actor (Z; Napoleon; Grand Prix), and singer, dies of a heart attack at 70

Alessandro Lessona, Minister of Italian Colonies (1931-38), dies

Nov 10 Dick the Bruiser [William Fritz Afflis], American professional wrestler, dies at 62

Nov 10 Franco Malfatti, president of Commission of Europe (1970-1972), dies

Nov 10 Tutte Lemkow, dancer and director (Capt Paradise; I Am A Camera), dies at 73

Diane Brewster, American actress (Courage of Black Beauty), dies at 60

Nov 12 Paul-Émile Léger, Canadian Cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church and Archbishop (Montreal), dies at 87

Cyril Poitier, actor (Uptown Saturday Night), dies of cancer at 80

Nov 13 Hanson Baldwin, US military historian, dies at 88

Tony Richardson, British film director (Tom Jones), dies of AIDS at 63

Ralph Marrero, American actor (Dawn of the Dead; The Babe; Johnny Suede), dies in car accident at 33

Nov 16 Wallace Berry, American-Canadian composer, educator, and music theorist, dies at 63

Adrian Quist

Australian tennis player, analyst (Australian C'ship 1936, 40, 48), dies at 78

John Blatnik, (Rep-Minn, 1947-75), dies at 80

Nov 17 Kelly Jean Van Dyke-Nance, American actress, adult film performer and Jerry Van Dyke's daughter, commits suicide at 33

Nov 17 Paul Reid Roman, actor (Aviator, Blue Knight), dies of cancer at 55

Nov 17 Rudolf Petzold, German educator and composer, dies at 83

Gustav Husak, president of Czechoslovakia (1975-89), dies at 78

Reggie Nalder, Austrian actor (Mark of Devil), dies of bone cancer at 80

Gina Petrushka, actress (Exorcist, Sybil), dies at 82

Daniel Mann [Chugerman], American stage and screen director (The Rose Tattoo; The Teahouse Of The August Moon; Butterfield 8), dies of heart failure at 79

Nov 21 David "Sonny" Werblin, AFL owner (NY Jets), dies at 81

Nov 21 Prior Jones, West Indian cricket fast bowler (9 Tests, 25 wickets; Trinidad), dies at 74

Nov 21 Sonny Werblin, NY sports impresario, dies at 81

Jac de Jong [Jacobus Hendrik de Jong], Dutch entrepreneur and politician (Nedac-Sorbo), dies

Ken Uehara, actor (Honolulu-Tokyo), dies of heart failure at 82

Nov 23 Klaus Kinski [Naksynski], German-Polish actor (Aguirre, the Wrath of God, Nosferatu the Vampyre, Little Drummer Girl), dies at 65

Anton Furst, American production designer (Batman), dies at 47

Nov 24 Eric Carr [Paul Charles Caravello], American drummer (Kiss, 1980-91), dies of heart cancer at 41

Freddie Mercury

British singer-songwriter (Queen - "Bohemian Rhapsody"), dies of AIDS at 45

Eleanor Audley, American voice actress (Cinderella - "Wicked Stepmother"), dies at 86

Bob Johnson, collegiate and NHL ice hockey coach (University of Wisconsin Badgers, 1966-82; US Olympic team, 1976; Calgary Flames, 1982-87; Pittsburgh Penguins, 1990-91), dies of brain cancer at 60

Nov 26 Dehl Berti, Chiricahua Apache actor (Bonanza, Gunsmoke, Guns of Paradise), dies of a heart attack at 70

Nov 26 Ed Heinemann, American aircraft designer (Douglas Aircraft), dies at 83

Nov 26 François Billetdoux, French author (Word Awake), dies at 64

Frank Yerby, American novelist (The Foxes of Harrow), dies at 75

Nov 29 Louis Finkelstein, American historian and theologist (Pharizees), dies at 96

Nov 29 Ralph Bellamy, American actor (Rosemary's Baby, His Girl Friday, Trading Places), dies at 87

Zin Harris, New Zealand cricket batsman (9 Tests, 1 x 100, HS 101; Canterbury), dies at 64
